thread.title: UAE storm: Sheikh Hamdan thanks Dubai workers
thread.title_full: UAE storm: Sheikh Hamdan thanks Dubai workers

title: UAE storm: Sheikh Hamdan thanks Dubai workers

persons.name: sheikh hamdan bin mohammed bin rashid al maktoum

text:
UAE storm: Sheikh Hamdan thanks Dubai workers Web Team /Dubai Filed on February 9, 2017 | Last updated on February 9, 2017 at 07.08 pm Share Vote 
(@faz3/Instagram) The Crown Prince gave a huge shout-out to the heroes, that don't wear capes, on social media After bravely documenting uprooted trees around Dubai's parks over the stormy weekend, Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Crown Prince of Dubai, is at it again. He took to Instagram to thank the valiant workers of Dubai for their efforts after the storm. Related: How Dubai royal family enjoyed snowy, stormy weekend In a series of Instagram stories, the Crown Prince documented local workers as they restored an uprooted tree to its former standing. Many trees toppled over when the UAE was lashed by strong winds and heavy rains. In some areas, the stormy weather even caused infrastructure to topple over and the Metro service to be closed temporarily. Crash along SZR: Crane crashes in stormy Dubai weather, 1 injured Here are some photos of Sheikh Hamdan's Instagram stories of workers putting a tree back up. He even took a moment to send out an inspiring message to his 4.8 million followers on Instagram asking them to accept falling down as a part of life. Share
